segments.source_content:
---
slug: /135
title: "This Week In React #135: Signals, Sandpack, React doc, Server References, TanStack Start, Next.js, Remix, Hydrogen, Storybook, Expo, TypeScript, rspack..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 02-21-2023
---

translations.zh-hant: @@untranslatable_placeholder_58cfcc64

segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

translations.zh-hant: 大家好！

segments.source_content: After a little break, we catch up with 2 weeks of news: a packed edition!

translations.zh-hant: 經過短暫休息後，我們整理了兩週的新聞：這是內容滿載的一期！

segments.source_content: **This Week In React just celebrated its 3rd birthday!** I made a [little thread](https://link.slo.im/3-years) to explain where I am, including links to my "build in public" pages. TLDR: the newsletter is finally viable, with more than **17500 subscribers**, growing fast, and **27k€** turnover in 2022. Thanks you for supporting me over the years and making all this possible!

translations.zh-hant: **This Week In React 剛剛慶祝三週年！** 我發表了[一篇貼文](https://link.slo.im/3-years)說明現況，包含我的「公開建構」頁面連結。簡言之：這份電子報終於實現可行性，擁有超過 **17,500 位訂閱者**且持續快速增長，2022年營收達 **27,000 歐元**。感謝大家多年的支持，讓這一切成為可能！

segments.source_content: The [Call for Paper](https://conference-hall.io/public/event/5hkuk4Ueg7U9y0uwNRRK) for the [React-Native-Connection](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) conference (June 1st in Paris) is open. Don't hesitate to participate. Travel and 2 nights of hotel are taken care of for the speakers. I am part of the program committee.

zh-hant.translation: 巴黎 [React-Native-Connection](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) 會議（6月1日）的[徵稿活動](https://conference-hall.io/public/event/5hkuk4Ueg7U9y0uwNRRK)已開放。歡迎踴躍投稿，主辦方將承擔講者的交通與兩晚住宿費用。我是議程委員會成員之一。
zh-hant.reason: URL for a 'link' was changed from 'https://conference-hall.io/public/event/5hkuk4Ueg7U9y0uwNRRK' to 'https://reactnativeconnection.io/'.

segments.source_content: I'm going to change the way I do the [Twitter thread](https://slo.im/thread) for various reasons. In particular, I find that the formality of the thread makes me less authentic and does not spark any interesting discussions. I also feel that the Twitter algorithm is becoming less and less fond of external links and is penalizing me. I will continue to be active on Twitter to share React news with you, but in another form.

translations.zh-hant: 基於多種原因，我將調整[Twitter 貼文](https://slo.im/thread)的發布方式。特別是發現貼文的正式性讓我顯得較不真實，也未能引發有意義的討論。同時感覺 Twitter 演算法對外部連結越來越不友善，導致曝光受限。我仍會在 Twitter 分享 React 相關消息，但會採用不同形式。

segments.source_content: <!-- truncate -->

translations.zh-hant: @@untranslatable_placeholder_45c63027

segments.source_content: **💡 [Check this newsletter on Twitter](https://slo.im/thread) - visual format 🎨**

translations.zh-hant: **💡 [在 Twitter 查看本期電子報](https://slo.im/thread) - 視覺化格式 🎨**

segments.source_content: [![refine](/emails/issues/135/refine.png)](https://github.com/refinedev/refine)

translations.zh-hant: [![refine](/emails/issues/135/refine.png)](https://github.com/refinedev/refine)

segments.source_content: [**refine - 100% open-source, headless React framework for building CRUD apps**](https://github.com/refinedev/refine)

translations.zh-hant: [**refine - 100% 開源、無頭式 React 框架，專為建構 CRUD 應用程式而設計**](https://github.com/refinedev/refine)

segments.source_content: [Check out refine](https://github.com/refinedev/refine) before starting your next admin panel, dashboard or internal tool. You'll be amazed at how much faster you can develop while still remaining flexible!

translations.zh-hant: 在開始下一個管理後台、儀表板或內部工具前，[試用 refine](https://github.com/refinedev/refine)。您將驚嘆於開發速度的提升，同時仍保持高度靈活性！

segments.source_content: ## ⚛️ React {#react}

translations.zh-hant: ## ⚛️ React {#react}

segments.source_content: [![useSignal() is the Future of Web Frameworks](/emails/issues/135/signals.jpg)](https://www.builder.io/blog/usesignal-is-the-future-of-web-frameworks)

translations.zh-hant: [![useSignal() is the Future of Web Frameworks](/emails/issues/135/signals.jpg)](https://www.builder.io/blog/usesignal-is-the-future-of-web-frameworks)

segments.source_content: **[`useSignal()` is the Future of Web Frameworks](https://www.builder.io/blog/usesignal-is-the-future-of-web-frameworks)**

translations.zh-hant: **[`useSignal()` 是 Web 框架的未來](https://www.builder.io/blog/usesignal-is-the-future-of-web-frameworks)**

segments.source_content: Misko is the creator of Qwik and AngularJS. He highlights the interest of signals, and makes a comparison with the way React works. React uses directly the value of the state, while signals use a getter, and create subscriptions when this getter is called.

translations.zh-hant: Misko（Qwik 和 AngularJS 的創建者）強調了 signals 的優勢，並與 React 的運作方式進行對比。React 直接使用狀態值，而 signals 使用 getter 方法，並在調用時建立訂閱關係。

segments.source_content: Signals allow for automatic optimization of re-renders with fine granularity, without the need for memoization. Intermediate components that sometimes only do props drilling do not need to re-render.

translations.zh-hant: Signals 能自動實現細粒度的重新渲染優化，無需記憶化處理。僅負責屬性傳遞的中介元件無需重新渲染。

segments.source_content: This article was published the day after the [Angular announcement](https://twitter.com/angular/status/1625939902046117890) that plans to use signals (a [demo](https://twitter.com/sarah_edo/status/1628065696247857152) is now available).

translations.zh-hant: 這篇文章發表於 [Angular 宣布](https://twitter.com/angular/status/1625939902046117890)計劃採用 signals 的隔天（現已有[演示](https://twitter.com/sarah_edo/status/1628065696247857152)）。

segments.source_content: Andrew Clark has [commented](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1626590880126889984) on the potential introduction of signals in React. He prefers for the moment to bet on the [React Forget](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lGEMwh32soc) compiler, which we should have news soon via a React Labs article. I think it's a good thing that React is going against the trend and continue to [explore the current direction](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1625599973420154881).

translations.zh-hant: Andrew Clark 已[評論](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1626590880126889984)在 React 中引入 signals 的潛在可能。他目前傾向押注 [React Forget](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lGEMwh32soc) 編譯器，預計將透過 React Labs 文章發布進展。我認為 React 逆勢而行並持續[探索現有方向](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1625599973420154881)是件好事。

segments.source_content: [![Announcing Sandpack 2.0 and a Node.js runtime for any browser](/emails/issues/135/sandpack2.jpg)](https://codesandbox.io/blog/announcing-sandpack-2)

translations.zh-hant: [![Announcing Sandpack 2.0 and a Node.js runtime for any browser](/emails/issues/135/sandpack2.jpg)](https://codesandbox.io/blog/announcing-sandpack-2)

segments.source_content: **[Announcing Sandpack 2.0 and a Node.js runtime for any browser](https://codesandbox.io/blog/announcing-sandpack-2)**

translations.zh-hant: **[宣佈 Sandpack 2.0 及適用於任何瀏覽器的 Node.js 運行環境](https://codesandbox.io/blog/announcing-sandpack-2)**

segments.source_content: CodeSandbox announced the new version of Sandpack, a tool that allows to create interactive live-coding experiences in the browser (code editor + preview). Sandpack integrates well with React thanks to a dedicated package. The v1 was already used on the new React beta docs site, by Josh Comeau and many others.

translations.zh-hant: CodeSandbox 宣佈了 Sandpack 的新版本，這是一個能在瀏覽器中創建互動式即時編碼體驗的工具（程式碼編輯器 + 預覽）。Sandpack 透過專用套件與 React 完美整合。v1 版本已被用於新版 React beta 文件網站、Josh Comeau 及其他許多場景。

segments.source_content: This v2 is based on the new NodeBox technology which allows to run Node.js in the browser. It is possible to run Next.js, Vite, Astro and other stacks.

translations.zh-hant: 此 v2 版本基於全新的 NodeBox 技術，可在瀏覽器中運行 Node.js。能夠運行 Next.js、Vite、Astro 等技術棧。

segments.source_content: This reminds of StackBlitz's technology, that just [announced the WebContainers API](https://blog.stackblitz.com/posts/webcontainer-api-is-here/). The Sandpack article explains the differences between NodeBox and WebContainers technologies.

translations.zh-hant: 這讓人聯想到 StackBlitz 的技術，該平台剛[宣佈了 WebContainers API](https://blog.stackblitz.com/posts/webcontainer-api-is-here/)。Sandpack 文章解釋了 NodeBox 與 WebContainers 技術的差異。

segments.source_content: [![useSignal() is the Future of Web Frameworks](/emails/issues/135/reactdocumentary.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pDqJVdNa44)

translations.zh-hant: [![useSignal() is the Future of Web Frameworks](/emails/issues/135/reactdocumentary.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pDqJVdNa44)

segments.source_content: **[React.js: The Documentary](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pDqJVdNa44)**

translations.zh-hant: **[React.js：紀錄片](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pDqJVdNa44)**

segments.source_content: You probably already know that a documentary about React is out 😉 ! I'm putting some cool bonus links:

translations.zh-hant: 您可能已經知道關於 React 的紀錄片已經上線 😉！我整理了一些精彩補充連結：

segments.source_content:
- 🎥 [Q&A with the cast of React.js: The Documentary](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzRSysq7F4k): Michael Chan asks some interesting questions to the original React team.
- 📜 [Behind the Scenes with React.js: the Documentary](https://newsletter.pragmaticengineer.com/p/react-documentary): behind-the-scene interview with Ida who created the documentary.
- 📜 [Adopting React in the Early Days](https://cult.honeypot.io/reads/adopting-react-in-the-early-days/): my outsider's perspective on this period.

translations.zh-hant:
- 🎥 [《React.js：紀錄片》演員問答](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzRSysq7F4k)：Michael Chan 向原始 React 團隊提出深度問題
- 📜 [《React.js：紀錄片》幕後花絮](https://newsletter.pragmaticengineer.com/p/react-documentary)：紀錄片創作者 Ida 的幕後專訪
- 📜 [早期採用 React 的歷程](https://cult.honeypot.io/reads/adopting-react-in-the-early-days/)：我對這段時期的外部觀察視角

segments.source_content:
- 🐦 [Andrew Clark - "I'm joining Vercel"](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1623353741750546439). He keeps his role in the React team.
- 🐦 [Netflix using React for its TV UI](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1628391651835011076): we tend to forget it because Netflix doesn't communicate much about their proprietary TV UI technology. Kaleb was supposed to give a talk at React NYC, but the conference was cancelled: he's looking for a new conference, so invite him!
- 👀 [React PR - Enable passing Server References from Server to Client](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/26124): an interesting PR that allows client components to call server callbacks, in the current RPC trend.
- 👀 [React PR - Suspense for CPU-bound trees](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1628128850377940993): feature that could come soon in a minor version.
- 👀 [TanStack Start](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1627740526551175190): new React meta-framework being developed?
- 👀 [Next.js Route Handlers](https://twitter.com/nextjs/status/1626341664402051072): new Next.js solution to replace routes API?
- 👀 [RFC: React Aria Components](https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum/pull/4058): React Aria wants to offer a slightly higher level layer to facilitate the use of the library.
- 🧵 ["JSX could have been 2x faster if it was designed more optimally for JS VMs!"](https://twitter.com/mhevery/status/1626422858862960648): interesting thread, especially Dan Abramov's response, which nuances the proposition outcomes.
- 🧵 [Dan Abramov - "20’s: Composing server and client as one paradigm"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1625225990023655425)
- 📖 [Migrating to Modern Redux](https://redux.js.org/usage/migrating-to-modern-redux): new available doc.
- 📜 [Hydrogen v2 is Remixed](https://twitter.com/remix_run/status/1623744656701026306): as expected, the Shopify Hydrogen framework moved to Remix. The article lists some benefits. In reality, it's not really a v2: they decided to use a different versioning strategy.
- 📜 [The Power of Keys in Framer Motion](https://www.nan.fyi/keys-in-framer-motion): great interactive article, explains the interest of using React keys to trigger animations.
- 📜 [Leveraging Server Context for Advanced Next.js Optimization Patterns](https://prismic.io/blog/advanced-nextjs-server-context): very good article about server context which is still present, but has become more implicit with Server Components. The low level API `AsyncLocalStorage` is useful to deduplicate server requests and create a cache.
- 📜 [How to handle errors in React](https://www.developerway.com/posts/how-to-handle-errors-in-react): today [I learned a useful fancy technique](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1628340871899893768) to ensure that error boundaries catch all kind of errors, not just those thrown during React render.
- 📜 [OSS Feature Decision Tree](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/oss-feature-decision-tree): Dominik explains how he decides if a feature will be integrated into React-Query. This reminds me of the [Extensible Web Manifesto](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1627637410438815744).
- 📜 [The case for frameworks](https://seldo.com/posts/the_case_for_frameworks): answer to Alex Russell, explains why we choose to adopt a rather heavy framework like React despite the negative impact on performance.
- 📜 [Effective Higher-Order Components](https://www.bbss.dev/posts/effective-hocs/): lists some recommendations and anti-patterns of HOCs, without overselling them. The author likes hooks, but there are still some relevant uses of HOCs.
- 📜 [Detecting Nested Components in React with the Context API](https://www.aleksandrhovhannisyan.com/blog/react-context-nested-components/): useful context technique to know. To complete: you should not be afraid to use a context provider on several levels, sometimes in order to enrich the value of the context as you go deeper in the tree.
- 📜 [Improved type safety in Storybook 7](https://storybook.js.org/blog/improved-type-safety-in-storybook-7/): Component Story Format 3 + TypeScript `satisfies` improves the type safety.
- 📜 [Maximising performance with React code splitting techniques](https://edvins.io/react-code-splitting-techniques)
- 📜 [Modularizing React Applications with Established UI Patterns](https://martinfowler.com/articles/modularizing-react-apps.html)
- 📜 [A Historical Reference of React Criticism](https://www.zachleat.com/web/react-criticism/)
- 📜 [A minimal, multi-framework, responsive image component](https://dev.to/ascorbic/a-minimal-multi-framework-responsive-image-component-3iop)
- 📜 [Using WebSockets in a Redux Application](https://www.taniarascia.com/websockets-in-redux/)
- 📜 [How to Integrate GreenSock with Remotion](https://enlear.academy/how-to-integrate-greensock-with-remotion-e4eee6f5a41f)
- 📜 [What Netlify's Acquisition of Gatsby Really Means](https://remotesynthesis.com/blog/gatsby-plus-netlify/)
- 🎥 [Fireship - 7 better ways to create a React app](https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=2OTq15A5s0Y)
- 🎥 [Killing ReactJS - A Guide For Hopeful Frameworks](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMUKsAf2Rfs)
- 📦 [Remix 1.13](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.13.0): Tailwind + PostCSS support
- 📦 [MDX 2.3](https://github.com/mdx-js/mdx/releases/tag/2.3.0): new compiler options to support other frameworks than React, relying on other naming conventions (className vs class for example)
- 📦 [Unovis - modular data visualization framework for React, Angular, Svelte...](https://unovis.dev/)
- 📦 [Redwood 4.1](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v4.1.0)

translations.zh-hant: @@untranslatable_placeholder_ca1573da

segments.source_content: ## 💸 Sponsor {#sponsor2}

translations.zh-hant: ## 💸 贊助商 {#sponsor2}

segments.source_content: [![surveyjs.jpg](/emails/issues/136/surveyjs.jpg)](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)

translations.zh-hant: [![surveyjs.jpg](/emails/issues/136/surveyjs.jpg)](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)

segments.source_content: **[Extensible JavaScript libraries for surveys and forms](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)**

translations.zh-hant: **[可擴展的 JavaScript 表單與問卷調查函式庫](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)**

segments.source_content: [SurveyJS](https://github.com/surveyjs) is a set of open-source JavaScript form libraries that you can easily integrate into your web app. It lets you **create and run multiple forms**, retaining all sensitive data on your servers, or have **your own self-hosted WYSIWYG form builder** that non-tech users can use directly.

translations.zh-hant: [SurveyJS](https://github.com/surveyjs) 是一套開源 JavaScript 表單函式庫，可輕鬆整合至您的網頁應用。它能讓您**創建並運行多種表單**，所有敏感資料皆保留在您的伺服器上，或擁有**自主託管的 WYSIWYG 表單建構器**供非技術用戶直接使用。

segments.source_content: You can also **analyze survey results** in custom-built dashboards, save your forms to PDF, or simply **convert them to editable PDF files**. It offers native support for **React and Angular rendering** and total freedom of choice as to the backend, because **any server + database combination is fully compatible**.

translations.zh-hant: 您還能在自建儀表板中**分析調查結果**，將表單另存為 PDF，或直接**轉換為可編輯的 PDF 文件**。原生支援 **React 與 Angular 渲染**，後端擁有完全選擇自由，因為**任何伺服器與資料庫組合皆完全相容**。

segments.source_content: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}

translations.zh-hant: ## 📱 React-Native {#react-native}

segments.source_content: [![Expo SDK 48 beta is now available](/emails/issues/135/expo48.jpg)](https://blog.expo.dev/expo-sdk-48-beta-is-now-available-7ee5713d0937)

translations.zh-hant: [![Expo SDK 48 beta is now available](/emails/issues/135/expo48.jpg)](https://blog.expo.dev/expo-sdk-48-beta-is-now-available-7ee5713d0937)

segments.source_content: **[Expo SDK 48 beta is now available](https://blog.expo.dev/expo-sdk-48-beta-is-now-available-7ee5713d0937)**

translations.zh-hant: **[Expo SDK 48 beta 現已開放](https://blog.expo.dev/expo-sdk-48-beta-is-now-available-7ee5713d0937)**

segments.source_content: The new SDK Expo was released in beta almost 2 weeks ago. The stable version should be available vey soon! Highlights:

translations.zh-hant: 新版 Expo SDK 已於近兩週前發布 beta 版本。穩定版預計很快推出！重點功能：

segments.source_content:
- React Native 0.71.3 - React 18.2.0
- Expo Image v1 RC
- Expo Router v1 RC
- EAS builders under M1 by default
- Hermes engine by default
- All Expo modules support Fabric - experimental

translations.zh-hant:
- React Native 0.71.3 - React 18.2.0
- Expo Image v1 候選版
- Expo Router v1 候選版
- 預設啟用 M1 架構的 EAS 建構器
- 預設使用 Hermes 引擎
- 所有 Expo 模組支援 Fabric（實驗性）

segments.source_content:
- 🐦 [Sebastian Markbåge about Server Components: "one of the reasons it was even funded by Meta initially was because of the promise it saw using server-driven technologies on native"](https://twitter.com/sebmarkbage/status/1623175042971344896): another confirmation that React-Native Server Components make a lot of sense. Expo is probably the best placed to implement them.
- 👀 [React-Navigation 7 alpha](https://twitter.com/reactnavigation/status/1626648568189620238): static configuration API
- 📊 [State of React-Native 2022 - Survey Results](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/)
- 📜 [Expo Changelog: January 2023](https://blog.expo.dev/expo-changelog-january-2023-c5eab76df08)
- 📜 [Expo - Sunsetting “expo publish” and Classic Updates](https://blog.expo.dev/sunsetting-expo-publish-and-classic-updates-6cb9cd295378)
- 📜 [React Native at STRV in 2023](https://www.aronberezkin.com/posts/react-native-at-strv-in-2023)
- 📜 [How to use React Native Web with Storybook v7 beta](https://dev.to/dannyhw/how-to-use-react-native-web-with-storybook-v7-beta-1io7)
- 📦 React-Native-Skia - [Headless Support](https://twitter.com/wcandillon/status/1622558366940778496) + [Web-only support](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/1336): the lib is becoming more universal.
- 📦 [React-Native-MKKV 2.7.0](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1625059908927234048)
- 📦 [expo-github-action v8](https://twitter.com/cedricvanputten/status/1627732937008349186)
- 📦 [expo html-element v0.4.1](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1625984235713581057)
- 🐦 [SpaceX Starlink using Expo](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1626150388704452611)
- 💬 [Moving Fastlane to Mobile Native Foundation?](https://github.com/MobileNativeFoundation/discussions/discussions/194)
- 🎙️ [React-Native-Radio 259 - Tamagui with Nate Weinert](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-259-tamagui-with-nate-weinert)
- 🎙️ [React-Native-Radio 260 - Unpacking React Native 0.71](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-260-typescript-by-default-unpacking-react-native-071)

translations.zh-hant:
- 🐦 [Sebastian Markbåge 談服務端元件：「Meta 最初資助此專案的原因之一，是看中它在原生平台上應用服務端驅動技術的潛力」](https://twitter.com/sebmarkbage/status/1623175042971344896)：再次證實 React-Native 服務端元件的實用性。Expo 可能是實現此技術的最佳平台。

- 📜 [2023 年 STRV 中的 React Native 應用](https://www.aronberezkin.com/posts/react-native-at-strv-in-2023)
- 📜 [如何在 Storybook v7 beta 中使用 React Native Web](https://dev.to/dannyhw/how-to-use-react-native-web-with-storybook-v7-beta-1io7)
- 📦 React-Native-Skia - [無頭模式支援](https://twitter.com/wcandillon/status/1622558366940778496) + [僅限網頁支援](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/1336)：函式庫通用性提升。
- 📦 [React-Native-MKKV 2.7.0](https://twitter.com/mrousavy/status/1625059908927234048)

segments.source_content: ## 🧑‍💻 Jobs {#jobs}

translations.zh-hant: ## 🧑‍💻 職缺 {#jobs}

segments.source_content: 🧑‍💼 [**Passionfroot - Senior Full-stack Engineer (Remix) - €160k+, Berlin/remote**](https://passionfroot.recruitee.com/o/senior-fullstack-engineer)

translations.zh-hant: 🧑‍💼 [**Passionfroot - 資深全端工程師 (Remix) - €160k+，柏林/遠端**](https://passionfroot.recruitee.com/o/senior-fullstack-engineer)

segments.source_content: Passionfroot's mission is to empower the independent businesses of tomorrow via YouTube, Podcasts, Social Media, and Newsletters. Join us in building a tool that will empower creators globally to build scalable, sustainable businesses.

translations.zh-hant: Passionfroot 的使命是透過 YouTube、Podcast、社群媒體和電子報，賦能明日獨立企業。加入我們打造能協助全球創作者建立可擴展、可持續商業模式的工具。

segments.source_content: 🧑‍💼 [**Callstack - Senior React Native Developer - Fully Remote, PLN 21-32k net on B2B, monthly**](https://www.callstack.com/senior-react-native-developer)

translations.zh-hant: 🧑‍💼 [**Callstack - 資深 React Native 開發者 - 全遠端，B2B 月薪淨額 PLN 21-32k**](https://www.callstack.com/senior-react-native-developer)

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

translations.zh-hant: 想參與開發全球最熱門的應用程式嗎？渴望共同塑造 React Native 技術嗎？加入 React & React Native 領導團隊 Callstack。詳情請見官網，我們期待您的申請——盡情展現您的實力！

segments.source_content: 🧑‍💼 [**G2i - 100% Remote React Native Jobs**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)

translations.zh-hant: 🧑‍💼 [**G2i - 100% 遠端 React Native 職缺**](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i/status/1563204813881425926?s=20&t=ArRLC77BpRwXXCdx8fnUqw)

segments.source_content: We have several roles open for developers focused on React Native! Pay is ~160k plus 10% bonus. You must have production experience with RN and be based in the US. DM [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) to learn more and don't forget to mention This Week in React.

translations.zh-hant: 我們有多個專注於 React Native 的開發者職缺開放！薪資約為 16 萬美元外加 10% 獎金。您必須具備 RN 實際生產經驗且位於美國境內。請私訊 [@gabe_g2i](https://twitter.com/gabe_g2i) 瞭解詳情，別忘了提及 This Week in React。

segments.source_content: 💡 [How to publish an offer?](https://thisweekinreact.com/sponsor)

translations.zh-hant: 💡 [如何發布贊助機會？](https://thisweekinreact.com/sponsor)

segments.source_content: ## 🔀 Other {#other}

translations.zh-hant: ## 🔀 其他 {#other}

segments.source_content:
- [ts-reset](https://github.com/total-typescript/ts-reset): interesting idea, a kind of CSS reset for TypeScript that patches some annoying TS parts. For example, `.filter(Boolean)` becomes a real type-guard and does not return `undefined` types. Many other methods return `unknown` instead of `any`.
- [rspack](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@rspack/core) + [oxc](https://github.com/Boshen/oxc): ByteDance (TikTok) devs working on Rust alternatives to Webpack/Babel.
- [HOTScript - Higher-Order TypeScript](https://github.com/gvergnaud/hotscript): if you want to do functional programming in the type system, this project is for you 😄
- [Web Push for Web Apps on iOS and iPadOS](https://webkit.org/blog/13878/web-push-for-web-apps-on-ios-and-ipados/)
- [WebKit - Try out CSS Nesting today](https://webkit.org/blog/13813/try-css-nesting-today-in-safari-technology-preview/)
- [Container queries land in stable browsers](https://web.dev/cq-stable/)
- [TypeScript Course - Build a TypeScript Project From Scratch (free)](https://www.typescriptcourse.com/tutorials/build-a-typescript-project-from-scratch)
- [Understanding Monomorphism to Improve Your JS Performance Up to 60x](https://www.builder.io/blog/monomorphic-javascript)
- [Vercel Cron Jobs](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1625249090932994051)
- [Declarative Shadow DOM](https://webkit.org/blog/13851/declarative-shadow-dom/)
- [Rust to WebAssembly the hard way](https://surma.dev/things/rust-to-webassembly/)
- [Lighthouse 10.0](https://developer.chrome.com/blog/lighthouse-10-0/)
- [Safari Technology Preview 163](https://webkit.org/blog/13839/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-163/)
- [Bringing Javascript to WebAssembly for Shopify Functions](https://shopify.engineering/javascript-in-webassembly-for-shopify-functions)
- [How Deno’s Founder Is Rebuilding the Runtime of the Web](https://www.sequoiacap.com/article/deno-spotlight/)

translations.zh-hant:
- [ts-reset](https://github.com/total-typescript/ts-reset)：有趣的概念，類似 TypeScript 的 CSS 重置，修復 TS 中惱人的部分。例如 `.filter(Boolean)` 成為真正的類型守衛，不再返回 `undefined` 類型。許多方法改回傳 `unknown` 而非 `any`。
- [rspack](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@rspack/core) + [oxc](https://github.com/Boshen/oxc)：字節跳動（TikTok）開發者正打造 Webpack/Babel 的 Rust 替代方案。
- [HOTScript - Higher-Order TypeScript](https://github.com/gvergnaud/hotscript)：若想在類型系統中實踐函數式編程，此專案正適合您 😄
- [iOS 和 iPadOS 的 Web 應用程式推播通知](https://webkit.org/blog/13878/web-push-for-web-apps-on-ios-and-ipados/)
- [WebKit - 立即體驗 CSS 巢狀結構](https://webkit.org/blog/13813/try-css-nesting-today-in-safari-technology-preview/)
- [容器查詢登陸穩定版瀏覽器](https://web.dev/cq-stable/)
- [TypeScript 課程 - 從零建構 TypeScript 專案（免費）](https://www.typescriptcourse.com/tutorials/build-a-typescript-project-from-scratch)
- [理解單型態將 JS 效能提升 60 倍](https://www.builder.io/blog/monomorphic-javascript)
- [Vercel 定時任務](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1625249090932994051)
- [宣告式 Shadow DOM](https://webkit.org/blog/13851/declarative-shadow-dom/)
- [Rust 轉 WebAssembly 的硬派實踐](https://surma.dev/things/rust-to-webassembly/)
- [Lighthouse 10.0](https://developer.chrome.com/blog/lighthouse-10-0/)
- [Safari Technology Preview 163](https://webkit.org/blog/13839/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-163/)
- [為 Shopify Functions 引入 JavaScript 至 WebAssembly](https://shopify.engineering/javascript-in-webassembly-for-shopify-functions)
- [Deno 創辦人如何重建 Web 執行環境](https://www.sequoiacap.com/article/deno-spotlight/)
